definition: bitter and hateful (idiom)/to grieve and lament (over sth)
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: Investors cried foul at the initial $2 a share offering.
sentences.chinese: 投资者对每股2美元的初始报价痛心疾首。

sentences.english: One of the areas that cause retailers the greatest pain is markdowns .
sentences.chinese: 零售商最痛心疾首的事情就是减价销售。

sentences.english: His whole nature revolted against that case of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 他对那宗贪污案痛心疾首。

sentences.english: It actually may protect us to some degree from heartache and heartbreak.
sentences.chinese: 实际上它或许在某种程度上可以使我们免于痛心疾首。

sentences.english: But apart from hand-wringing, what have been the reactions to the famine?
sentences.chinese: 但除了痛心疾首外，世人对饥荒的反应又是如何呢？

sentences.english: Recalling mother's face and smile how we could not feel distressed and bitter?
sentences.chinese: 追忆母亲的音容笑貌，我们怎么能不痛心疾首呢？

sentences.english: Fan Hai Lei deplores greatly ground to say.
He seemed quite brokenhearted, and even cried a little.
sentences.chinese: 我似乎痛心疾首，甚至还伤心落泪。

definition: to beat one's chest and stamp one's feet (idiom)
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to wring one's hands (literally wring one's wrists)
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
